Company: Babcock & Wilcox Technical Services Y-12, LLC
Recap of Ownership Changes: B&W spun off from McDermott in 2010
Description: On May 27, 2015, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2015-03) to Babcock & Wilcox Technical Services Y-12, LLC, the former operating contractor for the Y-12 National Security Complex, for violations of Department of Energy worker safety and health program requirements relating to events involving worker exposure to lithium hydride and an unintentional firearm discharge.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On October 4, 2012, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation to Battelle Energy Alliance, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. Parts 830 and 835 associated with an August 30, 2011, elevated radiation extremity dose at the Hot Fuel Examination Facility, and a November 8, 2011, plutonium contamination event at the Zero Power Physics Reactor Facility at DOE's Idaho National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On January 13, 2012, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Consent Order to Battelle Energy Alliance at the Idaho National Laboratory related to issues associated with the inadvertent draining of cooling water from the reactor vessel at the Advanced Test Reactor that occurred during a maintenance outage on June 1, 2011. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On April 18, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Final Notice of Violation (SEA-2011-01) to Battelle Energy Alliance, LLC in accordance with 10 C.F.R. 824 for violations of DOE Manual 205.1-5 and the DOE Manual 470.4 series of directives related to classified information being introduced into unapproved information systems at DOE's Idaho National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On June 20, 2014, the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Independent Enterprise Assessments, Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2014-01) to Battelle Energy Alliance, LLC (BEA), for the sparger unit testing event that resulted in a BEA researcher sustaining second- and third-degree burns at the Idaho National Laboratory Engineering Demonstration Facility.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On January 7, 2011, the Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order to Battelle Energy Alliance, LLC associated with an unplanned extremity exposure from an exposed cesium-137 radiation generating device source at the Idaho National Laboratory Health Physics Instrumentation Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On April 27, 2016, the U.S. Department of Energy's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (WCO-2016-01) to Battelle Energy Alliance, LLC, the managing and operating contractor at DOE's Idaho National Laboratory, relating to an arc flash event that occurred during preventive maintenance on a vacuum breaker at the laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On November 21, 2014, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (NCO-2014-02) to Battelle Energy Alliance, LLC, for deficiencies related to three reactor core misload events that occurred at the Advanced Test Reactor at DOE's Idaho National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On October 24, 2014, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (WCO-2014-01) to Battelle Memorial Institute for deficiencies associated with implementation of the Chronic Beryllium Disease Prevention Program at DOE's Pacific Northwest National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On June 1, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (NCO-2015-02) to Bechtel National, Inc., the management and operating contractor for DOE's Waste Treatment and Immobilization Plant (WTP), for deficiencies in nuclear safety associated with misalignment between design documents and facility authorization bases; welds in vessels fabricated for and accepted at the plant; and implementation of WTP quality assurance and corrective action management programs. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On September 13, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order to Bechtel National, Inc. for deficiencies in commercial grade dedication processes for vendors supplying materials and components for construction of the at the Hanford Waste Treatment and Immobilization Plant. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On May 31, 2012, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2012-02) to Bechtel National, Incorporated for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with a July 16, 2010, foot injury to a millwright and a March 16, 2011, formwork panel rigging event that occurred at DOE's Hanford Waste Treatment and Immobilization Plat (WTP).
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On July 28, 2005, the U.S. Department of Energy issued a Consent Order to Bechtel Hanford, Inc. associated with two events that resulted in significant personnel uptakes to two individuals in December 2004 at the 618-2 Burial Ground at DOE's Hanford site. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On July 16, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation to Bechtel Jacobs Company, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 that were associated with a March 19, 2009, electrical arc incident in building K-1210 at DOE's East Tennessee Technology Park. Penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On July 16, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation to Bechtel Jacobs Company, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 824 associated with the theft of classified matter from DOE's East Tennessee Technology Park (ETTP) in October 2009.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On November 30, 2009, the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order to Brookhaven Science Associates for deficiencies in work control that led to the October 13, 2008, propane gas explosion that destroyed a well house at DOE's Brookhaven National Laboratory.  The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned 50-50 by Battelle and Stonybrook University)

Description: On August 29, 2013, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2013-01) to Brookhaven Science Associates, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with a fall injury event that occurred in Building 701 at the Brookhaven National Laboratory. Penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned 50-50 by Battelle and Stonybrook University)

Description: On November 23, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Enterprise Assessments' Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (WCO-2015-02) to Brookhaven Science Associates, LLC, relating to an electrical shock suffered by a subcontractor while working at the 220-foot level of a meteorological tower at DOE's Brookhaven National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned 50-50 by Battelle and Stonybrook University)

Recap of Ownership Changes: Jacobs Engineering acquired CH2M in 2017. Jacobs Engineering changed its name to Jacobs Solutions in 2022.
Description: CH2M Hill Hanford Group Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Colorado-based CH2M Hill Companies Ltd., agreed to pay $1.5 million to resolve allegations that it knowingly submitted false claims and paid kickbacks relating to a contract to operate and manage mixed radioactive waste at the Department of Energy's Hanford Nuclear Site in the state of Washington.
Agency: Energy Department referral to the Justice Department

Recap of Ownership Changes: Jacobs Engineering acquired CH2M in 2017. Jacobs Engineering changed its name to Jacobs Solutions in 2022.
Description: On July 25, 2000, the U.S. Department of Energy issued a Consent Order to CH2M Hill Hanford Group, Inc. relating to quality problems with the procurement of safety class piping for the W-314 Project at the Tank Farm Waste Remediation System at DOE's Hanford site. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On April 28, 2017, the U.S. Department of Energy and National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Consent Order (WCO-2017-01) to Consolidated Nuclear Security, LLC for deficiencies associated with an event in which a maintenance worker fell from a fixed ladder into a utility pit and sustained injuries at the Y-12 National Security Complex. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On January 29, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (NEA-2015-01) to Fluor-B&W Portsmouth, LLC, for violations of 10 C.F.R. Parts 820, 830, and 835 associated with the improper alteration of radiation protection records at DOE's Portsmouth Gaseous Diffusion Plant.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On July 8, 2014, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Independent Enterprise Assessments' Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2014-02) to Fluor-B&W Portsmouth, LLC, for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with the tip-over of a 60-ton hydraulic crane that occurred at DOE's Portsmouth Gaseous Diffusion Plant. Penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On March 12, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (WCO-2015-01) to Fluor-B&W Portsmouth, LLC for deficiencies in the recognition, handling, and disposal of asbestos containing materials and worker exposure monitoring for asbestos at DOEs Portsmouth Gaseous Diffusion Plant. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: Fluor Hanford Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Fluor Federal Services Inc. and Fluor Corporation, agreed to pay $4 million to resolve allegations that it knowingly submitted false claims and paid and received kickbacks relating to a contract to operate and manage mixed radioactive waste at the Department of Energy's Hanford Nuclear Site in Hanford, Washington.
Agency: Energy Department referral to the Justice Department

Description: On July 25, 2000, the U. S. Department of Energy issued a Consent Order (EA-2000-10) to Fluor Federal Services for quality problems with the procurement of safety class piping for the W-314 Project at the Tank Farm Waste Remediation System at DOE's Hanford site and deficiencies in the contractor's procurement quality assurance program.  The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On August 18, 2003, the U.S. Department of Energy issued a Consent Order (EA-2003-05) to Fluor Fernald, Inc. related to an unposted High Radiation Area adjacent to the thermoluminescent dosimeter irradiation facility that existed for over a year before discovery.  The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On October 29, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) and the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) issued a Consent Order to Lawrence Livermore National Security for deficiencies associated with implementation of the Chronic Beryllium Disease Prevention Program (CBDPP) and related work planning and control processes at the Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Bechtel, University of California, Babcock and Wilcox, URS, and Battelle)

Description: On September 25, 2014, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2014-03) to Lawrence Livermore National Security, LLC (LLNS), for violations of the Department of Energy's worker safety and health program (10 C.F.R. Part 851) associated with the sulfuric acid burn event that occurred at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory. Penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Bechtel, University of California, Babcock and Wilcox, URS, and Battelle)

Description: On August 25, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (NEA-2015-02) to Los Alamos National Security, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. Part 830 associated with programmatic deficiencies in the contractors' implementation of the nuclear criticality safety program at the Los Alamos National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by the University of California, Bechtel, BWXT and URS)

Description: On October 17, 2012 the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2012-03) to Los Alamos National Security, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with four electrical safety-related events that occurred between October 2010 and January 2011 at the Los Alamos National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by the University of California, Bechtel, BWXT and URS)

Description: On July 28, 2015, the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) issued a Final Notice of Violation (SEA-2015-02) to Los Alamos National Security, LLC for violations of the Department of Energy's classified information security requirements relating to a loss of classified matter at the Los Alamos National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by the University of California, Bechtel, BWXT and URS)

Description: On May 27, 2015, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2015-04) to Los Alamos National Security, LLC for violations of the Department of Energy's worker safety and health program requirements relating to a chlorine release event at the Los Alamos National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by the University of California, Bechtel, BWXT and URS)

Description: On October 18, 2010, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2010-04) to Los Alamos National Security, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with an electrical shock event that occurred in building 300 in technical area 16 at the Los Alamos National Laboratory on March 20, 2009.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by the University of California, Bechtel, BWXT and URS)

Description: On April 15, 2011, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (NEA-2011-01) to Los Alamos National Security, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 835 associated with unanticipated extremity radiation exposures that occurred at technical areas 48 and 53 on July 24, 2009,at the Los Alamos National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by the University of California, Bechtel, BWXT and URS)

Description: Fire Suppression System Issues at the Pantex Plant
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On August 11, 2011, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (NEA-2011-03) to National Security Technologies, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 830 associated with quality assurance deficiencies in the inspection and installation of penetration fire seals and other components at the Criticality Experiments Facility and Device Assembly Facility at the Nevada National Security Site.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Northrop Grumman, AECOM, CH2M Hill, and Babcock & Wilcox)

Description: On September 26, 2014, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (SEA-2014-02) to National Security Technologies, LLC (NSTec), for violations of Department of Energy's classified information security program requirements at the Nevada National Security Site.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Northrop Grumman, AECOM, CH2M Hill, and Babcock & Wilcox)

Description: On February 12, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Enterprise Assessments' Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2015-02) to Pacific Data Electric, Inc. (PDE) for violations of the Department's worker safety and health program requirements (10 C.F.R. 851) relating to a 277-volt electrical shock received by a PDE apprentice electrician at DOEs Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On October 7, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2010-06) to Parsons Infrastructure & Technology Group, Inc. for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 related to a hand injury that occurred while a worker was performing crane lubrication on October 6, 2009, at the Salt Waste Processing Facility at t DOE's Savannah River Site.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Company: Parsons Infrastructure and Technology Group, Inc.
Description: On April 13, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order to Parsons Infrastructure and Technology Group, Inc. for deficiencies in the oversight of suppliers of nuclear grade construction materials for the Salt Waste Processing Facility at DOE's Savannah River Site. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On July 13, 2015, the National Nuclear Security Administration (NNSA) issued a Final Notice of Violation (SEA-2015-01) to Sandia Corporation, the management and operating contractor for NNSA's Sandia National Laboratories, for violations of the Department of Energy's classified information security program requirements relating to the unauthorized disclosure and introduction of classified information into unapproved information systems.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On September 25, 2014, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2014-04) to Sandia Corporation, for violations of the Department of Energy's worker safety and health program (10 C.F.R. Part 851) associated with a lithium fire and explosion that occurred at Sandia National Laboratories.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On March 24, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Settlement Agreement (SSA-2011-01) to Sandia Corporation relating to an adverse trend in classified information security at the Sandia National Laboratories. The contractor accepted the terms of the Settlement Agreement.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On October 7, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation to Savannah River Nuclear Solutions, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with a nitric acid spill that occurred in F Area on August 18, 2009, and an electrical arc flash event with that occurred in the D Area powerhouse on September 23, 2009, at the Savannah River Site. Penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Fluor, Newport News Nuclear and Honeywell International)

Description: On July 22, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (NEA-2011-02) to Savannah River Nuclear Solutions, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. Parts 830 and 835 associated with a June 14, 2010, employee puncture wound injury that occurred at the F-Canyon Facility at DOE's Savannah River Site.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Fluor, Newport News Nuclear and Honeywell International)

Description: On November 9, 2012, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2012-04) to Savannah River Nuclear Solutions, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with a worker fall from an elevated work platform in the K-Area Complex at the Savannah River Site on July 1, 2011.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Fluor, Newport News Nuclear and Honeywell International)

Description: On April 19, 2016, the U.S. Department of Energy Office of Enterprise Assessments' Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (NCO-2016-01) to Savannah River Nuclear Solutions, LLC for nuclear criticality safety issues involving a loss of tank agitation and inadequate sample spacing that occurred at the Savannah River Site.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Fluor, Newport News Nuclear and Honeywell International)

Description: The U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Consent Order (NCO-2014-01) to UChicago Argonne, LLC, relating to the incorrect nuclear facility hazard categorization of Building 205 G-Wing at DOE's Argonne National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order. The penalty took the form of a contract fee reduction.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On March 26, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (NCO-2010-01) to Uranium Disposition Services, LLC for construction deficiencies at the DUF6 conversion buildings located at DOE's Portsmouth and Paducah Gaseous Diffusion Plants. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Recap of Ownership Changes: AECOM acquired URS in 2014
Description: On October 13, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order to URS Energy & Construction, Inc. associated with nuclear safety-related deficiencies in the contractor's corrective action management, quality improvement, and work control programs associated with the Sodium Bearing Waste Treatment Project at DOE's Idaho National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Recap of Ownership Changes: URS was acquired by AECOM in 2014; Amentum bought AECOM's federal business in 2020
Description: On September 1, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (NEA-2011-04) for violations of 10 C.F.R. Parts 830 and 835 associated with a radiological contamination event that occurred on September 29, 2010, during building demolition at DOE's Separations Process Research Unit.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Recap of Ownership Changes: URS was acquired by AECOM in 2014; Amentum bought AECOM's federal business in 2020
Description: On October 3, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2011-01) to URS-Washington Division for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with an October 4, 2010, hoisting incident that occurred when a telescopic gantry system tipped while lifting a shield plug at the Sodium Waste Bearing Treatment Project at DOE's Idaho National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On June 16, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Enterprise Assessments Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2015-05) to UT-Battelle, LLC, the operating contractor for DOE's Oak Ridge National Laboratory, for violations of the Department's worker safety and health program requirements (10 C.F.R. 851) relating to three events at the laboratory involving material handling and ergonomic hazards that resulted in injuries to two workers.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned 50-50 by Battelle and the University of Tennessee)

Description: On May 14, 2015, the U.S. Department of Energy's (DOE) Office of Enforcement issued a Consent Order (NCO-2015-01) to UT-Battelle, LLC, for deficiencies associated with an airborne radiation release and radiological uptake by workers that occurred during size reduction and repackaging of highly enriched uranium materials at DOE's Oak Ridge National Laboratory. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned 50-50 by Battelle and the University of Tennessee)

Recap of Ownership Changes: URS was acquired by AECOM in 2014; Amentum bought AECOM's federal business in 2020
Description: On August 19, 2010, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement issued a Preliminary Notice of Violation (WEA-2010-02) to Washington Closure Hanford, LLC for violations of 10 C.F.R. 851 associated with a worker fall from a catwalk in the Hanford High Bay Testing Facility at DOE's Hanford site on July 1, 2009.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Recap of Ownership Changes: URS was acquired by AECOM in 2014; Amentum bought AECOM's federal business in 2020
Description: On May 27, 2011, the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) Office of Health, Safety and Security's Office of Enforcement and Oversight issued a Consent Order to Washington River Protection Solutions, LLC (WRPS) for deficiencies associated with the WRPS' corrective action management program, radiation control program, and sealed radioactive source accountability and control program at the Hanford site. The contractor agreed to the Consent Order.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Energy Department Office of Enforcement
Current Parent Ownership Structure: joint venture (owned by Fluor, Newport News Nuclear and Honeywell International)

Company: National Technology and Engineering Solutions of Sandia, LLC
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement

Description: On October 6, 2022, the National Nuclear Security Administration issued a Final Notice of Violation (WEA-2022-02) to Centerra-Los Alamos for violations of the Department of Energy's worker safety and health program requirements (10 C.F.R. 851) associated with a live fire near miss event at Los Alamos National Laboratory.
Agency: Energy Department Office of Enforcement
